data.title: Equation High-Low
data.solution:
# Equation High-Low
cards = gets.split.map &:to_f
equation1 = "X + Y - N / D"
equation2 = "X - Y + N / D"
permutations = cards.permutation(4).to_a
answers = [equation1, equation2].flat_map{|eq| permutations.map{|i| values = i.dup
  values[-1] != 0 ? eval( eq.gsub(/[XYND]/){ values.shift } ) : nil } } - [ nil ]
high, low = [20, 1].map{|goal| answers.min_by{|i| (i - goal).abs }.round(2) }
puts "%.2f" % high, "%.2f" % low
data.statement:
Equation High-Low is a game created for the South Korean show "The Devil's Plan" (데블스 플랜).

You have three mathematical operations {{+}}, {{-}} and {{/}}. You are also dealt 4 random [[number]]s which can range from {{0}}-{{10}}. <<†>>

The aim of the game is to try to arrange your 4 [[number]]s and 3 operations in a way that either makes a result as close to {{20}} as possible (High) or as close to {{1}} as possible (Low). You must use all [[number]]s and operations.

Given 4 space separated [[number]]s from {{0}}-{{10}}, print the best result possible from arranging them to be close to {{20}} (High) and then print the best result possible aiming for {{1}} (Low). Print each rounded to 2 decimal places).

<<Example:>>
10 9 4 5
<<High>>: An optimal arrangement is
10 + 9 - 4 / 5 = 19 - 0.8 = 18.2
<<Low>>: An optimal arrangement is
9 - 10 + 5 / 4 = -1 + 1.25 = 0.25
<<Answer>>: So the answer is
18.20
0.25

<<Hint:>> You need to consider the two possible equations below and then check different permutations of which available numbers become 'A', 'B', 'C' and 'D'.
A + B - C / D
A - B + C / D

<<†>> The full rules are a bit more complicated, so here we play a simplified version.
data.stubGenerator:

write High
Low

STATEMENT
Equation High-Low
data.inputDescription: <<1 line :>> 4 space-separated [[number]]s which are integers from {{0}}-{{10}}
data.outputDescription:
<<First line :>> A float which is the result that is as close to {{20}} as possible (High), rounded to 2 decimal places.
<<Second line :>> A float which is the result that is as close to {{1}} as possible (Low), rounded to 2 decimal places.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Equation High-Low is a game created for the South Korean show "The Devil's Plan" (데블스 플랜).

You have three mathematical operations +, - and /. You are also dealt 4 random numbers which can range from 0-10. †

The aim of the game is to try to arrange your 4 numbers and 3 operations in a way that either makes a result as close to 20 as possible (High) or as close to 1 as possible (Low). You must use all numbers and operations.

Given 4 space separated numbers from 0-10, print the best result possible from arranging them to be close to 20 (High) and then print the best result possible aiming for 1 (Low). Print each rounded to 2 decimal places).

Example:
10 9 4 5
High: An optimal arrangement is
10 + 9 - 4 / 5 = 19 - 0.8 = 18.2
Low: An optimal arrangement is
9 - 10 + 5 / 4 = -1 + 1.25 = 0.25
Answer: So the answer is
18.20
0.25

Hint: You need to consider the two possible equations below and then check different permutations of which available numbers become 'A', 'B', 'C' and 'D'.
A + B - C / D
A - B + C / D

† The full rules are a bit more complicated, so here we play a simplified version.
Input
1 line : 4 space-separated numbers which are integers from 0-10
Output
First line : A float which is the result that is as close to 20 as possible (High), rounded to 2 decimal places.
Second line : A float which is the result that is as close to 1 as possible (Low), rounded to 2 decimal places.
Constraints
At least one of the numbers will be greater than 0 (since you can't divide by 0).
There will never be a need to choose between two equally good results (e.g. 21.00 vs 19.00 for High).
0 ≤ number ≤ 10
Example
Input
10 9 4 5
Output
18.20
0.25
